item.title: Germany floods: Merkel pledges support for victims
item.description: Angela Merkel says the "full extent" of the German floods will only be seen in the coming days.

item.title: Covid: Younger adults still at risk of serious organ damage - study
item.description: Adults below the age of 50 are almost as likely to suffer from medical complications as the over-50s.

item.title: I will sweat blood to win voters' respect, says Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: The Labour leader tells the BBC his party has a "trust issue", after talking to some of its ex-voters.

item.title: Covid: Be cautious as England lockdown ends, urges Whitty
item.description: It comes as the UK recorded nearly 50,000 new cases on Thursday - the highest number since January.

item.title: Covid staff shortage could shut meat production lines
item.description: The industry has warned of shortages as one in 10 staff are told to isolate by the NHS Covid app

item.title: Heat-health alert issued in England for weekend
item.description: Public Heath England wants people to look out for those who may be at risk in warmer weather.

item.title: Biden and Merkel 'united against Russia aggression'
item.description: "Good friends can disagree," Mr Biden says of their dispute over a Russia-to-Germany pipeline.

item.title: Durham A1 motorway crash: Police report fatalities
item.description: People are believed to have died after two lorries and several cars crashed on the A1 (M), police say.

item.title: Small shops face Â£1.7bn debt mountain, says report
item.description: The warning is in the latest report on the future of High Streets by former retail chief Bill Grimsey.

item.title: Goldman Sachs to require staff to wear masks from Monday
item.description: The banking giant hopes 70% of UK staff will return to its London office in the coming weeks.

item.title: Police and CPS in rape case blame game - report
item.description: An urgent shift in the way rape cases are investigated and prosecuted is needed, say watchdogs.

item.title: Covid: Al fresco dining to become a High Street fixture in England
item.description: Pavement licences are to be extended and takeaway pints will continue for another year to help the sector.

item.title: Public urged to count butterflies after year of bad weather
item.description: TV naturalist Chris Packham said the count could reveal the impact of climate change on wildlife.

item.title: The Papers: Britain's 'pingdemic paralysis' amid record alerts
item.description: Many papers react to the news that the NHS Covid app sent more than half a million alerts in a week.

item.title: In pictures: Floods kill dozens in Germany and Belgium
item.description: Record rainfall caused rivers to burst their banks, leaving at least 70 dead in Germany and Belgium.

item.title: Cbeebies bedtime stories and why Hollywood stars are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John.

item.title: On the tenth anniversary of her death a new film about Amy Winehouse is being released
item.description: A new Amy Winehouse film, narrated by her mum, is being released on the tenth anniversary of her death.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The gymnasts 'building bridges between cultures'
item.description: The town of Murayama in northern Japan is preparing to welcome a team of Bulgarian Olympians.

item.title: Llandudno goats sent to Bristol and Bournemouth to control numbers
item.description: Thirty Great Orme goats are moving to Bristol and Bournemouth after numbers boomed in lockdown.

item.title: Finding 'Grace': Murder, DNA and ancestry
item.description: How a novel use of DNA and ancestry websites is helping police uncover clues in cold case murders.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Partner vows to keep searching for missing hiker
item.description: The partner of missing hiker Esther Dingley explains why he won't give up searching for her.

item.title: Formula 1 boss Ross Brawn says hydrogen could be future fuel
item.description: Hydrogen-powered cars could be the future of Formula 1 according to Ross Brawn, the F1 managing director for motorsports.

item.title: Dying alone in Indonesia's grim battle with Covid-19
item.description: Firefighters haul bodies from homes as hospitals scramble for oxygen in Asia's new Covid epicentre.

item.title: James Norton: 'Making Nowhere Special made me sob and want children'
item.description: The Grantchester actor on the emotional toll of playing a dying father and why he doesn't mind fame.

item.title: How your personal data is being scraped from social media
item.description: As hackers scoop up data from social media sites, should firms be taking better care of your data?

item.title: Oosthuizen leads Open after round one - highlights & report
item.description: Former champion Louis Oosthuizen leads The Open by one stroke from Jordan Spieth and Brian Harman after day one at Royal St George's in Kent.

item.title: Saka 'knew instantly of hate' he would receive after missed Euro 2020 final penalty
item.description: England's Bukayo Saka said he "knew instantly the kind of hate" he was going to receive after his miss in the penalty shootout in the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Andy 'The Viking' Fordham: Former BDO world darts champion dies aged 59
item.description: Former BDO world champion Andy 'The Viking' Fordham dies aged 59.

item.title: England's Ludlow banned for four matches for kneeing opponent in head
item.description: Gloucester flanker Lewis Ludlow is given a four-match ban for striking with the knee during England's victory over Canada at Twickenham.

item.title: McGregor 'had multiple stress fractures in shin' going into Poirier fight
item.description: Conor McGregor says he was already injured before suffering a broken leg in the fight with Dustin Poirier in Las Vegas at UFC 264.

item.title: The Open 2021: Lee Westwood, Rory McIlroy and Brandt Snedeker feature in best shots from day one of the Open 2021
item.description: Lee Westwood, Rory McIlroy and Brandt Snedeker feature in the best shots from day one of the Open 2021 at Royal St. George's.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The Making of Laura Kenny: Gold medals, severe injuries & becoming a mum
item.description: Four-time Olympic champion Laura Kenny looks back on the key moments that have shaped her journey to become Great Britain's most successful Olympic female competitor.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: Ghana's Kojo Marfo: Sell-out show for butcher-turned-painter
item.description: He's got rock star fans and two sold-out shows to his name, but Kojo Marfo prefers life's simple joys.

item.title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
item.description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: Bibaa and Nicole: The life after death of two sisters
item.description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman died in a senseless attack. But they should not be remembered as victims.
